name: wp-cron.php Enabled Leads to DoS Attack
description: WordPress cron system enabled via wp-cron.php allows resource exhaustion through repeated cron spam requests, leading to server overload.
verification_steps: 2. Monitor server load during repeated requests
3. Check cron event logs for spam triggers
remediation: Disable wp-cron.php via wp-config.php (define('DISABLE_WP_CRON', true)); Use server cron jobs instead.

name: Xmlrpc enabled Leads to Ping back attack
description: XML-RPC enabled allows distributed pingback amplification attacks, enabling DDoS via pingback.ping method.
verification_steps: 4. Check server logs for XML-RPC access
remediation: Disable XML-RPC via .htaccess or plugins like Disable XML-RPC. Block /xmlrpc.php entirely.

name: Username Enumeration via WordPress REST API
description: WP REST API /wp/v2/users endpoint exposes usernames without authentication.
remediation: Add .htaccess rule: RewriteRule ^wp-json/wp/v2/users - [F]. Use authentication plugins.

name: Email Flooding via Password Reset
description: wp-login.php?checkemail=1 endpoint abuse allows unlimited password reset emails.
remediation: Implement rate limiting via plugins (Limit Login Attempts). Add CAPTCHA to reset form.

name: Exposed WordPress Admin Username via Author Query
description: /?author=1 reveals admin usernames through IDOR in author archives.
remediation: Add .htaccess: RewriteCond %{QUERY_STRING} ^author=.* [NC] RewriteRule .* - [R=403]. Rename admin user.

name: Endpoint Disclosure (auto-generated WP REST routes)
description: WordPress auto-generates REST API routes exposing internal endpoints without permission checks.
remediation: Disable public REST endpoints or use authentication middleware.

name: Lack of Rate Limiting on WordPress Login
description: wp-login.php lacks brute-force protection, enabling unlimited login attempts.
remediation: Install Limit Login Attempts Reloaded. Add fail2ban rules for wp-login.php.

name: Username Enumeration via wp-login.php
description: Different error messages on wp-login.php reveal valid vs invalid usernames.
verification_steps: 2. POST known username with bad pass
remediation: Use uniform error: 'Invalid credentials'. Plugins: Rename wp-login.php.

name: Lack of Rate Limiting on Contact and Registration Forms
description: Contact/registration forms allow spam/DoS without submission limits.
remediation: Add reCAPTCHA v3. Rate limit via server config or plugins like WPForms Smart Tags.

name: Server Banner Grabbing
description: Server headers expose Apache/Nginx versions for targeted exploits.
remediation: Apache: ServerTokens Prod. Nginx: server_tokens off;.htaccess: Header unset Server.

name: Information Disclosure via readme.html
description: Root readme.html exposes exact WordPress version to attackers.
remediation: .htaccess: <Files readme.html> Order allow,deny Deny from all </Files>. Delete file.

name: HSTS Not Implemented
description: Missing HSTS header enables HTTPS downgrade and MITM attacks.
remediation: Add to .htaccess: Header always set Strict-Transport-Security 'max-age=31536000; includeSubDomains'. Use security plugins.
